children: Ultrasound of the tibial side of the knee showing monosodium urate deposition on the cartilage surface of a patient with gout. The light heterogeneous area at the top represents soft tissue; the dark area at the bottom is subchondral bone. The bottom bright white line (
) represents the bone/cartilage interface, and the clear zone above it (
) is the cartilage. Above the cartilage, and between the cartilage and the soft tissue, a second bright white line may be seen (
), creating a double-contour sign, which indicates the presence of urate and is found in many patients with gout.
